required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Observational Study Conducted on Patients Receiving the ESOP 2 Stem to Confirm Security and Performance of the Device
clinical_study.official_title: Prospective Observational Clinical Study Conducted Over a 10-year Period on Patients Who Received the ESOP 2 Stem to Restore Joint Function, in Order to Confirm Security and Performance of the Device

brief_summary.textblock: This study is a post-market clinical follow-up conducted in order to collect long-term data on security and performance of the ESOP 2 stem, which is intended to be implanted in case of total hip replacement, when used in real life conditions according to the instructions for use.

detailed_description.textblock:
The primary objective of this study is to evaluate the security of the ESOP 2 stem by calculating the survival rate up to 10 years of follow-up.
The secondary objectives are to evaluate the security and performance of the device by assessing radiological data, gathering complications and evaluating functional score and quality of life score up to 10 years of follow-up.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: immediate post-op, 3 months post-op, 1 year post-op, 5 years post-op, 10 years post-op
secondary_outcome.description: Radiological results such as stability, osteointegration will be evaluated.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: per-op, 3 months post-op, 1 year post-op, 5 years post-op, 10 years post-op
secondary_outcome.description: All complications will be gathered during intervention and up to 10 years postoperatively.

secondary_outcome.measure: Functional outcomes such as pain, mobility
secondary_outcome.time_frame: pre-op, 3 months post-op, 1 year post-op, 5 years post-op, 10 years post-op
secondary_outcome.description: Functional outcomes will be determined by the Harris Hip score. This score ranges from 0 to 100, where, the higher the score, the better the patient outcome.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: pre-op, 3 months post-op, 1 year post-op, 5 years post-op, 10 years post-op
secondary_outcome.description: Quality of life will be determined by the OXFORD-12 score. This score ranges from 12 points to 60 points, where, the higher the score, the better the patient outcome.

intervention.intervention_name: Hip prosthesis - ESOP 2 cementless femoral stem
intervention.description: ESOP 2 femoral stems are intended to be implanted in the femoral region during total hip arthroplasty in order to restore joint function.

study_pop.textblock: Patients from participating hospitals will be enrolled as part of their clinical routine care.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subject implanted with ESOP 2 stem in one of the following indication according to the instructions for use: hip disorders; femoral neck fracture
- Subject who received an information form and is willing to participate in the study
Exclusion Criteria:
- Contraindications described in the instructions for use
- Usual surgical contraindications
- Subject who is not able to express his/her non-opposition
